channel.title: Speaking Brazilian Podcast
channel.description: Speaking Brazilian Language School specializes in Brazilian Portuguese. New lessons every Wednesday with tips on grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation of Brazilian Portuguese.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn Brazilian Portuguese
channel.itunes:summary: Speaking Brazilian Language School specializes in Brazilian Portuguese. In this podcast, you’ll find new lessons every week with tips on grammar, vocabulary and pronunciation of Brazilian Portuguese.
channel.itunes:author: Virginia Langhammer

item.title: How to use the words Tão, Tanto, Quão and Quanto
item.itunes:title: How to use the words Tão, Tanto, Quão and Quanto
item.description:
Join the Speaking Brazilian YouTube Club to have access to the transcript of my videos: https://school.speakingbrazilian.com/p/youtube

Start learning Brazilian Portuguese today! Take advantage of all the free resources offered by Speaking Brazilian Language School: https://www.speakingbrazilian.com/free

*

Speaking Brazilian Language School specializes in Brazilian Portuguese. We offer online courses for students of all levels.  

Aprenda o português do brasil. Learn Brazilian Portuguese. Aprende el portugués de Brasil. Apprenez le portugais du Brésil. Lerne Portugiesisch aus Brasilien. Impara il portoghese brasiliano.

item.title: The 5 Regions of Brazil - MIDWEST
item.itunes:title: The 5 Regions of Brazil - MIDWEST
item.description:
The Midwest is the least known region in Brazil, but not less important. It is in the Midwest that Brazil's capital is located, and one of the most beautiful and preserved biomes in Brazil, the Pantanal. In the previous lessons, I talked about the other 4 regions of Brazil, Southeast, South, Northeast, and North, and in this lesson, you’ll learn a little about the Midwest. I hope you like it!

item.itunes:title: The 5 Regions of Brazil - NORTH
item.description:
Do you know the North of Brazil? The North is known mainly for being the region where the famous Amazon Forest is located. In the last few lessons, I talked a little about the regions Southeast, South, and Northeast, and in this lesson, you will learn a little about the North. I hope you like it!

item.title: The 5 Regions of Brazil - SOUTHEAST | Brazilian Portuguese
item.itunes:title: The 5 Regions of Brazil - SOUTHEAST | Brazilian Portuguese
item.description:
Did you know that Brazil is divided into 5 regions? North, Northeast, Midwest, Southeast, and South. Each of these regions has different characteristics. I decided to make a lesson about each of these regions for you to learn a little more about Brazil. In this lesson, I’m going to talk a little bit about the Southeast region, where we find the best-known cities in Brazil. I hope you like it!

item.itunes:title: My trip through Utah | Brazilian Portuguese
item.description:
Hi everyone. I'm going to travel through the state of Utah for a few days, and I'm bringing you with me. On this trip, I visited a lot of amazing places, including Salt Lake City, Bonneville Salt Flats, Bryce National Park, Zion National Park, Monument Valley, and Arches National Park. I hope you like it!

item.description:
For this lesson, I invited another Portuguese teacher to talk with me about accents and expressions used in Rio de Janeiro. We had a long conversation via Zoom, and I recorded the conversation to share with you. As our conversation was a bit long, I divided the lesson into two parts. You’ll listen to the first part today and the second part will be available next week. I hope you like it!

item.title: How to pronounce English words in Brazilian Portuguese
item.itunes:title: How to pronounce English words in Brazilian Portuguese
item.description:
Last week, you learned a little about Anglicism, which is the use of words borrowed from English into Portuguese. In the previous lesson, we talked about 10 words, and today we're going to see 10 more examples of words borrowed from English that were adapted to Brazilian Portuguese. You'll learn how to use and how to pronounce these words in Brazil. I hope you like it!

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

item.title: 10 English words we use in Brazil
item.itunes:title: 10 English words we use in Brazil
item.description:
Have you ever heard of "anglicism"? Anglicism is the use of words borrowed from English into another language. In Brazil, we use many words borrowed from English, but we pronounce these words with a strong Brazilian accent. In this lesson, you’ll learn 10 words that we borrow from English and use commonly in Brazil. I’ll explain to you how Brazilians use and pronounce these words.

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

Start learning Brazilian Portuguese today! Take advantage of all the free resources offered by Speaking Brazilian Language School:

item.title: How to talk about coronavirus in Portuguese | Vocabulary Lesson
item.itunes:title: How to talk about coronavirus in Portuguese | Vocabulary Lesson
item.description:
In today's lesson, you’ll learn useful vocabulary related to what is happening in the world today. To be honest, I didn't want to record an episode talking about the coronavirus because I imagine you are tired of hearing about it, but many students asked me to talk about it. So, I decided to make this episode about common vocabulary that we are listening to in the media every day so that you can better follow the news in Portuguese. I hope it will be useful for you.

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

item.title: How to understand native speakers
item.itunes:title: How to understand native speakers
item.description:
Can you understand Brazilians when they talk to each other? One of the biggest challenges for Portuguese learners is to understand Brazilians when they speak naturally. This is normal and it happens with all languages. When native speakers speak to each other, they speak fast, they use slangs and expressions, they drop letters, so it’s really difficult to understand what they are saying. But don’t worry! In today's lesson, I'm going to give you 2 tips that will help you finally understand Brazilians.

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

Start learning Brazilian Portuguese today! Take advantage of all the free resources offered by Speaking Brazilian Language School:

item.title: 3 easy ways to practice Portuguese every day
item.itunes:title: 3 easy ways to practice Portuguese every day
item.description:
One of the biggest problems for anyone learning Portuguese is finding a way to practice Portuguese regularly, without having to travel to Brazil. My students ask me all the time, “How can I practice Portuguese?”, “Where can I find people to practice Portuguese with me?” So, in today's lesson, I'll give you 3 tips for practicing Portuguese regularly. I hope you like it!

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

item.itunes:title: HOW I LEARNED 4 LANGUAGES
item.description:
Many of you have asked me to record an episode speaking the foreign languages I’ve learned. So today, I’ll share with you, in 4 different languages, how I learned to speak 4 languages: Portuguese, which is my mother tongue, English, French and Spanish. I hope you like it!

Language teachers I recommend:

Rachel's English: https://www.youtube.com/user/rachelse...

Speak English with Vanessa: https://www.youtube.com/user/theteach...

MmmEnglish: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrRi...

English with Max: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCbug...

Français Authentique: https://www.youtube.com/user/francais...

Prof. de Français Yasmine Lesire: https://ilearnfrench.eu

Unlimited Spanish: https://www.unlimitedspanish.com/podc...

item.description:
We are starting a new year and a new decade! I really like this time of the year because I see the beginning of a new year as the beginning of a new phase in my life. This is a good moment to reflect on our life goals and plan so that we can achieve our goals. In this video, I’m going to share with you 2 strategies I use to set and achieve my goals, including learning new languages. I hope you like it!

item.title: Portuguese for Beginners: POSSESSIVE PRONOUNS
item.itunes:title: Portuguese for Beginners: POSSESSIVE PRONOUNS
item.description:
Do you know how to use possessive pronouns in Portuguese? Possessive pronouns are those little words that indicate ownership: MEU/MINHA (my/mine), SEU/SUA (your/yours), among others. In this lesson, you’ll learn what they are and how to use possessive pronouns in Portuguese.

Start learning Brazilian Portuguese today! Take advantage of all the free resources offered by Speaking Brazilian Language School:

item.title: Past Perfect in Portuguese | Mais-Que-Perfeito
item.itunes:title: Past Perfect in Portuguese | Mais-Que-Perfeito
item.description:
Have you ever heard of a verb tense called more-than-perfect past tense (pretérito mais-que-perfeito)? Don’t be alarmed by the name of this verb tense because it’s very easy to use and easy to conjugate. This tense is equivalent to the past perfect in English and just like in English, it’s a very common tense you need to know.

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

item.title: Present Perfect Continuous in Portuguese
item.itunes:title: Present Perfect Continuous in Portuguese
item.description:
"O que você tem feito?" (What have you been up to?) Today, you will learn to talk about what you have been doing by using a compound verb tense called: “pretérito perfeito composto”. This tense is equivalent to the present perfect progressive (continuous) in English and as in English, it’s a very common tense you need to know.

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

item.title: TUDO or TODO? How to use these words in Portuguese.
item.itunes:title: TUDO or TODO? How to use these words in Portuguese.
item.description:
Do you know what is the difference between TUDO and TODO? My students ask me this all the time!⁠ ⁠ For this reason, I decided to make this lesson so that you learn once and for all when to use the word TUDO and when to use the word TODO.⁠ ⁠⁠ To explain the difference between TUDO and TODO, I like to compare with English, because it makes it very easy to understand.⁠ ⁠ TUDO means "everything" in English and TODO means "every" or "all". Easy, right?⁠ ⁠ Listen to this episode to learn more!⁠

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

Start learning Brazilian Portuguese today! Take advantage of all the free resources offered by Speaking Brazilian Language School:

item.title: BRAZILIAN VOCABULARY in Real Life: Farmers Market
item.itunes:title: BRAZILIAN VOCABULARY in Real Life: Farmers Market
item.description:
Today I’ll take you with me to the farmers market (feira, in Portuguese). “Feira” is the equivalent of a farmers market in the United States. Here in Brazil, in addition to fruits and vegetables, you also find typical food. I'll take you with me so that you learn a little about this Brazilian universe. I hope you like it!

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

Do you know how to use the future subjunctive in Portuguese? In this lesson, you’ll learn the most common use of the future subjunctive.

Click here to read the entire transcription of this episode.

Start learning Brazilian Portuguese today! Take advantage of all the free resources offered by Speaking Brazilian Language School:

1. Take a free mini-course in pronunciation

2. Subscribe to weekly YouTube lessons

3. Follow me on Instagram

4. Join my Facebook community

5. Read my blog

*

Speaking Brazilian Language School specializes in Brazilian Portuguese. We offer online courses for beginners and one-on-one classes for students of all levels.
